thread.title: UberEATS set to launch Manchester restaurant delivery service
thread.title_full: UberEATS set to launch Manchester restaurant delivery service

author: Emily Heward
title: UberEATS set to launch Manchester restaurant delivery service
text:
What's On UberEATS set to launch Manchester restaurant delivery service Bundobust, Barburrito, Northern Soul Grilled Cheese, The Alchemist, Brewdog and more have signed up as Uber takes on Deliveroo in Manchester Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get What's On   
Uber is taking on Deliveroo with the launch of its food delivery service UberEATS in Manchester tomorrow. 
More than 100 of the city’s restaurants, cafes and bars have already signed up to the taxi network’s takeaway app, including Bundobust, The Koffee Pot, Barburrito, Northern Soul Grilled Cheese, The Alchemist and Brewdog, with more set to follow. 
Launched in the UK in London last year (watch the video above to see how it works), UberEATS operates in a similar way to Uber’s rides service, allowing customers to place their order on an app and watch it arrive in real-time via a live map. 
A fleet of scooter and bike riders will courier meals within a delivery area covering the city centre and suburbs including Didsbury and Chorlton, with plans to expand its zones in the coming months. 
Couriers will aim to get food to customers’ doors in 30 minutes for a flat £2.50 delivery charge, with no minimum order value. Read More Manchester restaurant offers and deals: February 2017 
Mathieu Proust, general manager for Manchester at UberEATS, said: “We have a bit of a love story with Manchester. It was the second place in the UK we launched our transport business and the food scene is great there. 
“With UberEATS, Mancunian foodies can enjoy dishes from eateries that wouldn’t normally deliver, allowing them to relish restaurant-worthy food in the comfort of their own homes.” UberEATS 
Several of the restaurants signed up will be exclusive to UberEATS, including newly-opened Indian street food kitchen Bundobust. 
Mark Husak, co-founder of the Piccadilly restaurant and bar, said: “We’re over the moon to be partnering with UberEATS. The people of Manchester will be able to order the most authentic Indian street food this side of Mumbai to their homes and offices. 
"As a new business in the city centre we are always looking at ways of spreading the good word of Bundobust and with UberEATS, we are confident we can reach out to a whole new customer base.” UberEAT's Manchester delivery zones 
The Koffee Pot and The Alchemist will also be offering delivery for the first time via the app. 
Simon Potts, managing director at The Alchemist, said: “We’re excited to be one of the first bar and restaurants in Manchester to partner with UberEATS following its success in London. At The Alchemist we have a fantastic all-day menu with delicious dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as nibbles and it’s great to be able to bring that menu to new and familiar customers in such a convenient way.” 
UberEATS will be available seven days a week, from 11am to 11pm. To find out more, visit ubereats.com . Read More
